item.title: Stacy add a quote by Augustine of Hippo
item.description: "Does God proclaim Himself in the wonders of creation? No. All things proclaim Him, all things speak. Their beauty is the voice by which they announce God, by which they sing, "It is you who made me beautiful, not me myself but you." -- Augustine of Hippo

item.title: Stacy add a quote by Brother Lawrence
item.description: "I cannot imagine how religious persons can live satisfied without the practice of the presence of GOD. For my part I keep myself retired with Him in the depth of centre of my soul as much as I can; and while I am so with Him I fear nothing; but the least turning from Him is insupportable." -- Brother Lawrence

item.title: Stacy add a quote by Alister E. McGrath
item.description: "The reading of old books enables us to avoid becoming passive captives of the Spirit of the Age by keeping “the clean sea breeze of the centuries blowing through our minds.”415" -- Alister E. McGrath
